events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving a rear-end collision at a traffic light on April 30th.
The claim was categorised as an Auto Accident based on the description of the incident.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to help the customer through the claims process.
The claim was officially acknowledged and the customer received confirmation with next steps.
Requested police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and medical reports related to the accident.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including photos, police report, and repair estimates.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacted involved parties.
Investigation confirmed claimant was not at fault; collision details verified with police and witnesses.
A settlement offer was proposed covering vehicle repairs and medical expenses related to the accident.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling of their auto accident claim and settlement offer.
The claim was approved in full after customer accepted the proposed settlement terms.
Insurance payment was issued to the customer and the repair shop to cover damages.
The claim was closed following successful settlement and payment distribution.
All case files and communications were archived according to company retention policy.
